Verak Lith, also called Flametongue, is the second boss in the second elite dungeon, Dragonkin Laboratory. He was created sometime after the King Black Dragon, and is significantly stronger than his famed predecessor.

According to the dragonkin research, Verak Lith was a dragon being developed to deal with the Stone of Jas' curse. Phalaks noted that it was much more destructive than his own creation, eventually taking charge of its development. Kerapac eventually insisted to have Verak reproduce, which was not his primary role and was eventually deemed a failure as most of his offspring burned themselves out with their "unceasing rage and over-advanced flame-sacs", prompting Phalaks to resign in disgust.

During the end of the God Wars Verak Lith, then called Flametongue, caused massive destruction in the already battle-ravaged Wilderness. Guthix sent some of his dwarven forces to drive the terrible monster from the land. The mission was a success, as Flametongue was defeated and withdrew, but he evidently survived and is imprisoned in the Dragonkin Laboratory to the present day.

Achievements[edit | edit source]

Main article: Verak Lith achievements
  • Broodmother ( 30) – Defeat Verak Lith without anyone dispersing their damage into a pile of eggs.
  • Dragonhide Infanticide ( 20) – Defeat Verak Lith while ensuring every ricocheted attack is absorbed and dispersed into a pile of eggs.
  • Dragon Ink ( 20) – Collect the following lore books from bosses inside the Dragonkin Laboratory.
  • Superiority Complex:
    • Superiority Complex I ( 5) – Defeat Verak Lith. (X/5)
    • Superiority Complex II ( 5) – Defeat Verak Lith. (X/10)
    • Superiority Complex III ( 5) – Defeat Verak Lith. (X/25)
    • Superiority Complex IV ( 5) – Defeat Verak Lith. (X/50)
    • Superiority Complex V ( 5) – Defeat Verak Lith. (X/75)
    • Superiority Complex VI ( 5) – Defeat Verak Lith. (X/100)
  • Superiority Complex Solo Kills:
    • Superiority Complex Solo Kills I ( 5) – Defeat Verak Lith while not in a group. (X/5)
    • Superiority Complex Solo Kills II ( 5) – Defeat Verak Lith while not in a group. (X/10)
    • Superiority Complex Solo Kills III ( 5) – Defeat Verak Lith while not in a group. (X/25)
    • Superiority Complex Solo Kills IV ( 5) – Defeat Verak Lith while not in a group. (X/50)
    • Superiority Complex Solo Kills V ( 5) – Defeat Verak Lith while not in a group. (X/75)
    • Superiority Complex Solo Kills VI ( 5) – Defeat Verak Lith while not in a group. (X/100)

Update history[edit | edit source]

This information has been compiled as part of the update history project. Some updates may not be included – see here for how to help out!
  • ninja 14 March 2022 (Update):.
    • The drop rate of unique items across Elite Dungeon modes has been increased to give a unified drop rate per clear:
      • Greater ability codices from Astellarn, Verak Lith and the black stone dragon (per player).
        • Solo - 100/10,000 increased to 120/10,000.
        • Duo - 60/10,000 (unchanged).
        • Trio - 40/10,000 (unchanged).
  • patch 8 June 2020 (Update):
    • Resolved an issue which would cause the incorrect poison colour to be applied to a player during the Verak Lith boss fight.
  • patch 17 February 2020 (Update):
    • Players can no longer receive the first two bosses from Elite Dungeons as Reaper assignments.
  • patch 28 May 2019 (Update):
    • Prevented a safe spot abuse with Verak Lith.
  • patch 1 April 2019 (Update):
    • Removed squeak sound effect from Verak Lith's auto attacks.
  • patch 28 August 2018 (Update):
    • Verak Lith's ricochet breath can no longer be healed from with the Resonance
  • patch 20 August 2018 (Update):
    • Prevented Verak Lith and players from damaging each other when the player is not in the arena.
    • Verak Lith's barriers now go up earlier to prevent players escaping back across the bridges after aggroing him.
    • Damage stored for soaking Verak Lith's richochet'd breaths is now cancelled when the player is removed from the arena (such as via death)
  • update 13 August 2018 (Update):
    • Added to game.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • His name is dragonkin language for King/Emperor Superior.
  • Verak Lith is the only boss in the elite dungeons that drops loot after his death animation finishes, as opposed to dropping loot as soon as he dies.
  • The nickname Flametongue was first used by a King Black Dragon faced by Guthix' army on the "King of the Hill" level of the Guthix Awakens campaign in the RuneScape-based strategy game Armies of Gielinor. In the level, Flametongue was in command of red dragons and TzHaar-Ket followers called "Flame Keepers".
  • Prior to the update on 28 August 2018, Verak Lith's energy attack could be healed off of with Resonance. The change was implemented due to the fact that attempting to Resonance a soft typeless hit would negate the damage, but not heal the player.
  • Like the Queen Black Dragon, Verak Lith does not drop black dragonhides, despite being a black dragon himself.

  3. ^ a b c d Jagex. Mod Orion's Twitter account. 14 August 2018. (Archived from the original on 20 August 2018.) Mod Orion: "Yeah it's a base 10% chance so hopefully better luck with Astellarn and Verak Lith :)"
  4. ^ a b c Jagex. "This Week In RuneScape: Combat Cleanup Strike." 14 March 2022. RuneScape News.
  5. ^ RuneScape. "mysterious perk :o." Twitch video. 21 July 2020. "Mod Orion: 'If you have the Mysterious perk on your equipment and you go into the dungeon, it's like 500x more common. So, enjoy your free pet.'"
